app.name: Flow CLI
app.one_liner: A command-line interface for interacting with the Flow blockchain and building decentralized applications.

core_loop: Developers use the Flow CLI to initialize projects, generate Cadence code templates, manage accounts, deploy contracts, and interact with Flow network entities like blocks, collections, and events.

screens.name: Main CLI Interface
screens.purpose: Provide entry point for all Flow CLI commands and super commands.

rust_commands.name: init
rust_commands.purpose: Start a new Flow project with default configuration and directory structure.

rust_commands.name: generate
rust_commands.purpose: Generate template files for common Cadence code structures.

rust_commands.name: accounts
rust_commands.purpose: Create and retrieve accounts and deploy contracts.

rust_commands.name: blocks
rust_commands.purpose: Retrieve block information from the Flow network.

rust_commands.name: collections
rust_commands.purpose: Retrieve transaction collections from the Flow network.

rust_commands.name: events
rust_commands.purpose: Retrieve event logs emitted by transactions on the Flow network.

mvp_plan: week 1: Implement core command parsing and routing
week 1: Set up project initialization scaffold
week 1: Integrate basic account and contract management
acceptance_tests: User can run 'flow init' to create a new project with correct structure.
User can generate Cadence templates using 'flow generate'.
CLI retrieves live block data when running 'flow blocks'.
Fork test caching is supported as per latest release notes.
open_questions: How to handle EVM manipulation POC integration in stable builds?
What is the long-term strategy for linter suggested fixes?
